page.title: 03VILLAGES:HOUSING
page.content: Private housing in the two villages takes the form of either individual development or small parcels of land having been developed by local, rather than national, building firms. The location in bonny countryside and the proximity to Dundee are the two main factors in play here. This is reflected in the type of first time occupiers of these new houses. They tend to be either newly retired couples who have settled finally in a "place in the country", or young married couples who are upward mobile, many of whom may move again as dictated by the husband's employment. In the most recent private development in Newbigging, completed only this year, 4 out of 21 houses have already changed hands. This is in contrast to the more settled population of the council houses.
